what: juice + markdown: Convert R Markdown into HTML with Inline Styles
title: juice + markdown: Convert R Markdown into HTML with Inline Styles
text: goal juicedown offer useful tools minimize routine formatting page contents CMS/LMS Moodle code editor silently ignore style link tags. generate CSS-inlined HTML, package uses juicyjuce package along knitr markdown packages.

title: juice + markdown: Convert R Markdown into HTML with Inline Styles
text: Sometime soon (hopefully!), can install CRAN like : time , can install development version juicedown GitHub :

title: juice + markdown: Convert R Markdown into HTML with Inline Styles
text: Main function convert(). (Usually, need dir argument) List sample file directories List contents sample see source:
code: library(juicedown) convert(juicedown_example("markdown", "sample.md"), dir = ".", clip = FALSE)  # See the result # browseURL("sample.html") juicedown_example() #> [1] "from-html"  "include"    "javascript" "markdown"   "yaml-meta" juicedown_example("javascript") #> [1] "economics.xlsx" "sample.html"    "sample.Rmd" file.show(juicedown_example("javascript", "sample.Rmd"))

title: Hide/Show text — anki

text: HTML code span.

title: Hide/Show text — anki_setup
text: function inserts JavaScript code anki texts. Call function code chunk somewhere R Markdown file. Use anki() function inline r code, make hidden block.

title: Hide/Show text — anki_setup
code: anki_setup(   background = "yellow",   color = "blue",   border = "slateblue",   padding = 3,   margin = 3,   cursor = "pointer" )

title: Hide/Show text — anki_setup
text: background character. Background color blank box. color character. Font color answer blank box. border character. Border color blank box. padding integer. Space answer text border. margin integer. Left right margin around border. cursor character.

text: character. CSS/JavaScript code anki texts.

what: Converts R Markdown file into HTML fragment with inline styles — convert
title: Converts R Markdown file into HTML fragment with inline styles — convert
text: function facilitates writing contents R Markdown formats CMS source editor silently removes style tags. run interactively, resulting HTML code copied clipboard. basically three things: converts (R) Markdown file HTML file knitr::knit() + markdown::mark(), embed CSS information style atribute juicyjuice::css_inline(), extracts article/div element ready copying pasting CMS's source editor.

title: Converts R Markdown file into HTML fragment with inline styles — convert
code: convert(   file = NULL,   dir = NULL,   tag = NULL,   id = NULL,   clip = TRUE,   full_html = NULL,   remove_script = NULL,   stylesheet = NULL,   template = NULL )

title: Converts R Markdown file into HTML fragment with inline styles — convert
text: file character. Path (R)markdown file. dir character. Output directory. tag character. Surrounding tag HTML block, "article" "div" allowed. id character. ID attribute surrounding tag. clip logical. Whether copy result clipboard. Ignored (set FALSE) full_html = TRUE. Default TRUE. full_html logical. Produce complete HTML HTML block ? remove_script logical. Whether remove script tags. Ignored (set FALSE) full_html = TRUE. stylesheet character. Paths CSS files used markdown::mark() template character. Path template used markdown::mark()

title: Converts R Markdown file into HTML fragment with inline styles — convert
text: Invisibly returns character vector identical result file.

title: Converts R Markdown file into HTML fragment with inline styles — convert
text: Currently, three global defaults available. can set defaults alter appearance result. juicedown.template: Defaults juicedown:::pkg_file("xml", "template.html") juicedown.article.css: Defaults juicedown:::pkg_file("css", "article.scss") juicedown.div.css: juicedown:::pkg_file("css", "div.scss")

title: Converts R Markdown file into HTML fragment with inline styles — convert
text: can pass conversion parameters function argument YAML metadata (juicedown key) parameters, global options, priority given order. instance, stylesheet parameter exists function call, used. YAML metadata stylesheet key juicedown key, used. example, .css used.   neither function argument missing YAML metadata exist, global option (juicedown.article.css) used.

title: Converts R Markdown file into HTML fragment with inline styles — convert
code: file <- juicedown_example("markdown", "sample.md") tdir <- tempdir() convert(file, dir = tdir, clip = FALSE) unlink(file.path(tdir, "sample.html"))

what: Convert a HTML file into a HTML block to be copied and pasted for CMS. — convert_html2cms
title: Convert a HTML file into a HTML block to be copied and pasted for CMS. — convert_html2cms
text: Convert HTML file HTML block copied pasted CMS.

title: Convert a HTML file into a HTML block to be copied and pasted for CMS. — convert_html2cms
code: convert_html2cms(   in_text,   full_html = the$full_html %||% FALSE,   tag = the$tag %||% "body",   id = the$id,   remove_script = the$remove_script %||% FALSE )

title: Convert a HTML file into a HTML block to be copied and pasted for CMS. — convert_html2cms
text: in_text character. Character vector representing HTML file convert. full_html logical. TRUE, produce complete html output, convenient drafting document. option enabled, tag id remove_script options silently ignored. tag character. Outer-tag resulting HTML snippet. id character. id attribute outer-tag. remove_script logical. TRUE, script tags stripped .

title: Convert a HTML file into a HTML block to be copied and pasted for CMS. — convert_html2cms
text: character. HTML block.

title: Counter factory. — counter
text: Define counter cnt <- counter("type"). Add cross-referenced label document cnt$set("ref"). Refer "ref" cnt$get("ref").

title: Counter factory. — counter
code: counter(label, open = NULL, close = NULL, sep = " ", link = FALSE)

title: Counter factory. — counter
text: label character. Default prefix counter. open character. Opening bracket "(" "[" close character. Closing bracket ")" "]" sep character. Separator label counter. link logical. TRUE, get() method returns counter surrounded tag, linked referenced id.

title: Counter factory. — counter
text: List functions set get counters label.

title: Counter factory. — counter
code: cnt <- counter("Quiz") cnt$set("aaa") #> [1] "Quiz 1" cnt$set() #> [1] "Quiz 2" cnt$set("bbb", quiet = TRUE) cnt$get("aaa") #> [1] "Quiz 1" cnt$get("bbb") #> [1] "Quiz 3" cnt$get("aaa", type = "bare") #> [1] "1" cnt$dump() #> $aaa #> [1] 1 #>  #> [[2]] #> [1] 2 #>  #> $bbb #> [1] 3 #>

Insert text into a document. — includeText
text: path Path child document. data Environment list used knit child document. quiet Passed knitr::knit().

title: Insert text into a document. — includeText
text: R object class "knit_asis" (defined knitr package), data represents content child document (knitr::knit())

title: Insert text into a document. — includeText
code: template <- tempfile() cat("Hello, `r name`.\n", file = template) includeText(template, data = list(name = "Alice")) #> [1] "Hello, Alice." #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "knit_asis" #> attr(,"knit_cacheable") #> [1] NA file.remove(template) #> [1] TRUE

what: juicedown: 'juice' + 'markdown': Convert 'R Markdown' into 'HTML' with Inline Styles — juicedown-package
title: juicedown: 'juice' + 'markdown': Convert 'R Markdown' into 'HTML' with Inline Styles — juicedown-package
text: convenience tool create 'HTML' inline styles using 'juicyjuice' 'markdown' packages. particularly useful working content management system (CMS) whose code editor eliminates style link tags. main use case package learning management system, 'Moodle'. Additional helper functions teaching purposes provided. Learn 'juicedown' https://kenjisato.github.io/juicedown/.

title: juicedown: 'juice' + 'markdown': Convert 'R Markdown' into 'HTML' with Inline Styles — juicedown-package
text: Maintainer: Kenji Sato kenji@kenjisato.jp (ORCID) [copyright holder]

title: List example files — juicedown_example
text: List example files package. Show path exact name given.

title: List example files — juicedown_example
text: name character. single string example name. file character. single string main file.

title: List example files — juicedown_example
text: character. list example files path string example file.

title: List example files — juicedown_example
text: package sample files organized samples directory like : samples/ |– -html/ |   -- sample.html – include/ |– pic/ `– sample.Rmd juicedown_example() equivalent ls samples, juicedown_example("-html") ls samples/-html, juicedown_example("-html", "sample.html") shows full path.

title: juicedown 0.1.2
text: CRAN release: 2025-09-16 Fix: Rd cross-references now use package anchors (e.g., \link[knitr:knitr-package]{knitr}, \link[knitr:knit]{knitr::knit}). Fix: Replaced accidental base pipe |> %>% keep Depends: R (>= 3.6.0). Docs: Follow conventional DESCRIPTION URL/BugReports formatting. Thanks @olivroy #3 (see https://github.com/kenjisato/juicedown/pull/3#issuecomment-2607211598).

title: juicedown 0.1.2
text: First release.
